content: The "Consular Review Act of 1998" establishes a Board of Visa Appeals under the Immigration and Nationality Act. The "Consular Review Act of 1998" establishes a Board of Visa Appeals within the Department of State, composed of 5 members appointed by the Secretary of State, with the authority to review discretionary decisions of consular officers regarding immigrant and nonimmigrant visas. The Board of Visa Appeals reviews decisions made by consular officers on visa applications, with the authority to overrule or remand decisions if contrary to the evidence. Proceedings follow regulations set by the Secretary of State. The Board of Visa Appeals reviews consular officers' decisions on visa applications, following regulations set by the Secretary of State. Regulations include providing notice of the review process, making written records available, and notifying the consular officer within 30 days of a review request.
